title: Ticket #4805: putClassAd non-blocking mode doesn't work
description:
The refactor of putClassAd in #4448 contains a small bug which breaks the non-blocking mode. BlockingModeGuard is used as following: 

BlockingModeGuard(rsock, true);

However, this causes the object to be destroyed immediately. We really want this to stay in scope until the end of the code block. For that: 

BlockingModeGuard guard(rsock, true);

In particular, this prevents the V3 query protocol to actually be non-blocking (probably not a big deal in 8.3.2, as the query protocol forks a child in most cases).
